text: Jay Edward Adams (January 30, 1929 â€“ November 14, 2020) was an American Reformed Christian author. He wrote more than 100 books. His books have been translated into 16 languages. He was also known as the founder of The Institute for Nouthetic Studies. Adams was born in Baltimore, Maryland. He also created nouthetic counseling. Adams died on November 14, 2020 in Woodruff, South Carolina at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American translators Category:Writers from Baltimore
title: Jay E. Adams
